Relations, Whitehall, London. Report on the working of the Kuwait Order-in-Council 1935 for the year 1947. Sir, With reference to Article 89 of the Kuwait Order-in-Council, 1935, I have the honour to state that (1) Civil cases . No civil cases were tried curing the year (2) Criminal cases . Three criminal cases were tried during the year. In the first two cases fines of Rs.200 ana 500 respectively were collected and credited to Government, in the third case the accused was acquitted. (3) Registration . 1,651 British subjects were registered during the year. Nine of tner^ were registered gratis anu a sum of rs. 1,64a was collected from the remainder. 2. This report was, in the past, sent to the Government of India. I have the honour to be. Sir, Your most obedient servant, for Political Re-sident in the Persian ^ Gulf. SUBJECT : Report on the working of the Kuwait ORDER-In-Council for the year 1946. Sir, With reference to Article 89 of the Kuwait Order-in- Council, 1926, I have the honour to state that: (1) No civil cases were tried during the year; (2) Two criminal cases were tried during th 4 year and in one case a fine of Rs, 100/- was collected and creuited to Gov rnment. (2) 528 British subjects were registered uurin the year unuer review. 11 of them were registered free and a sum of I&.517/- was collected from the rest. I have the honour to be, Sir, Tour most obedient servant, (Sd.) S.J.L. OLVER for Political Resident in the Persian Gulf. Report on the working of the Kuwait Order-in-Council for the year 1939. Sir In continuation of the letter from the Government of India in the Foreign and Political Department, No.D.1056-N/36, dated the 3rd March 1936 I am directed to forward a copy of letter from the Hon’ble the Political Resident in the Persian (Julf, No.562/18/110, dated the 25th March 1937, on the above subject. Report on the working of the Kuwait Order-in-Council for the year 1936. Sir With reference to Article 89 of the Kuwait Order-in-Council, 1935, I have the honour to state that:- 1. No Civil cases were tried during the year and 2. the trial of one Criminal case was taken during the year but it was subsequently transferred to the Rulers jurisdiction. 2. 124 British subjects were registered during the year 1936. Eight of these were registered free and a sum of Rs.116/- was collected for the remainder.INDEXED ^2 4 MAP 193G From To Sir No.D.l0b6-H/36. Report on the working of the Kuwait Order-in-Council for the year 1935. With reference to Article 89 of the Kuwait Grder- m-Council, 1930, I have the honour to state that:- 1 . 2 civil cases were tried during the year 2. in one case a fine of Rs. 20/- was levied, & 3 . no criminal cases were tried during the year. 2. 86 British subjects were registered during the year 1938. Sight of these were registered free and a sum of Rs. 48/- was collected for the remainder.EXED From The Foreign Secretary to the Governme~~ No.F.140-N/35. Report of the working of the Kuwait Order in Council for 1932. With reference to Article 85 of the Kuwait Order in Council, 1925, I have the honour to state that no Civil or Criminal cases were tried under the Order in Council during the year 1932. 2. 44 British subjects and 3 British Protected persons were registered during the year by the Political Agent, Kuwait. Of this number, 7 were registered gratis. Report on the working of the Kuwait Order-in-Council for 1930. With reference to Article 85 of the Kuwait Order-in-Council, 1925, I have the honour to submit for transmission to the Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs, Foreign Office, London, a report received No.32/11/56, dated the 22nd January 1931.) from the Political Agent, Kuwait, on the working of the Order for the year ended the 31st December 1930.Ko. 32/11/56. Political Agency, Kuwait, Dated tne 19/22na January 1931. Prom Lieutenant-Colonel H.R.P. Dickson, Political Agent, Kuwait, To The Secretary to the Hon’ble the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire. Sir, With reference to Article 85 of the Kuwait Order-in- Council 1925, 1 have the honour to submit herewith my report on the working of the Kuwait Order-in-Council, 1925, for the year 1930. CIVIL CASKS. Ho Civil cases were tried during the year 1930. criminal cases. Ko Criminal cases were tried during the year 1930. REGISTRATION. Thirty seven British subjects and four British protected persons were registered during the year 1930. Six of these were registered free and a sum of Rs.35/- was collected for the remainder. I have, etc., Sd. H.R.P. Dickson, Lt .Colonel, Political Agent, Kuwait.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Coll 25/1 'Orders in Council: Koweit; Reports on working of'

physicalDescription.extent: The file is arranged in chronological order from the back to the front.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 43; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: Short annual reports on the workings of the Kuwait Order-in-Council 1925 and 1935 for the years 1930-1947. The reports contain information on the civil and criminal cases tried and the numbers of British subjects and British protected persons registered during each year.The reports were sent by the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf to the Government of India, External Affairs Department, from where they were forwarded to the Political Department (External Department from 1942) of the India Office (Commonwealth Relations Office in 1948).

name.namePart: Indian Political Service, External Affairs Department
